reviews.review_title: Not an amazing film but a fun, nostalgic ride
reviews.content: Is it amazing acting? No. Did it have great writing? Of course not. BUT if you're a millennial like me and were a teenager watching films like She's all that and Scream etc. Growing up, you will appreciate the cameos of Rachael Leigh Cook (she's all that) and Matthew Lillard (scream) and the various nods and funny references to the originals. Including the dance scene and random lines that gave me strong Stuart vibes. Honestly, I was kinda smiling throughout just because of those so it was worth it just for the nostalgia.
An honest stinker of a "movie". Bad acting all around and who was that female lead? I can't call her an actress.

I would of rather been in ICU with pancreatic cancer than finish this movie. I would rather be I. A hostage situation where a the criminal is at odds with the seemingly novice hostage negotiator. Which later turns the hostage negotiator is actually in on the take. Which actually sounds like a better movie! Jesus, I'd rather watch that! Whiskey and Xanax here we go!

This movie is so bad it literally gave me cancer. I would of much rather been part of an hostage situation where the criminal and hostage negotiator were at odds at each other. The seasoned criminal outwitting the seemingly novice hostage negotiator who later turns out to be on the inside take as well.......well hell that sounds like a better movie all around! If I finish this movie it will be to the help of whiskey and Xanax......oh liver do not fail me now!!

reviews.review_title: Question: How did this get green-lit?
reviews.content: Answer: the entire movie, every scene and nearly every frame has product placement. They weren't even being sneaky about it lmao. There should be a disclaimer at the beginning of the movie.

reviews.review_title: I'd like to apply for the writing position at Netflix pls...
reviews.content: ... because I definitely can't do worse. The weird thing was, there were TINY SPECKS of relatively ok randomly thrown into this. It's ALMOST as though there was one writer in a group of 5 that had a good grasp on what this movie COULD have been, but wasn't really heard among the others. I picture my 14 year old actual teen in there trying to explain the audience to a bunch of old guys clapping themselves on the back and howling as they come up with such clever ideas as the bf turned ex getting caught in the act. NOBODY WILL SEE THAT COMING.However, seeing the turning of the tables of the beyond stale makeover trope had the potential to be refreshing. Lead guy being actually good at things rather than a "loser" was a good play. Him being pretty confident but uninterested in the superficial school atmosphere was less cringe than other standard plots.The idea that it was actually her that needed the makeover was well done. Just SUPERBLY POORLY EXECUTED. Figure out who that one writer was and keep them on. Fire everyone else. Stat.
It's literally one of the worse movies ive ever seen.

reviews.review_title: A movie where I couldn't help but start not caring half way.
reviews.content: I can understand the concept. But the idea was turning a male loser into the prom king. The second they had him take his shirt off and he has a better 6 pack abs then those who actually have one. And it goes down hill from there. You expect us to believe that round of horse shite. Um ya right. I'm sorry I like the actors and actresses but the story was just not believable. That alone made the movie fail. Just that simple.
It's just getting ridiculous at this point smh idk how some of these people even become famous lol.
Terrible acting, and very cringe. Couldn't wait till it was over. It's literally based of geek charming and it was predictable! #hatedit.

The original wasn't my fave film as a teen but it has a place in my heart and despite the ridiculous idea that Lainey was supposed to be unattractive pre makeover, it was fun, well acted and had a great song.Alas this remake has none of the charm, the song is ruined and the lead actress is unfortunately not quite good enough to lead a film. I am sure she is fab on tik tok though and I am way past my teens and that's who it's aimed
Also there is a weird dance off that is not half as good as it thinks it is.Matthew Lillard should have had more screen time.
All I can say it that it's the same as every other teen/high school film and the douche bag of ex girlfriend to the main female character reminded me of Jake Paul.
The acting is so bad i want to cry. I Don't recommend, everything was bad.
....if it wasn't for the acting, especially the main character played by Addison Rae. Otherwise the premise was quite good with updated themes to the original.

reviews.review_title: DO NOT WATCH!!! WASTE OF TIME!
reviews.content: ITS SAD THAT THEY THOUGHT THIS MOVIE WOULD DO GREAT JUST BY USING ADDISON RAES CLOUT! THEY WERE ALL HOORIBLE ACTORS BUT SHES BY FARRRRRR THE WORST!! I WANT MY TIME BACK THAT I WASTED WATCHING HALF OF THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE! ITS ALSO SAD THAT THEY CAST THIS HORRIBLE SHADOW ON THE ORIGINAL "HES ALL THAT" YOU HAVE TO HIRE GOOD ACTORS!! NOT JUST ASSUME YOURE MOBIE WILL DO GOOD BECAUSE THE MAIN STAR HAS A TON OF FOLLOWERS!! LIKE REALLY?? YOU GUYS BET OM THAT??! SO SAD BUT IM GLAD THAT EVERYONE ELSE AGREES!!!

The potential for nostalgia fooled me with a couple of actors from the original movie. Most of He's All That was very obvious advertising from many different companies and also appeared to be an opportunity for social media influencers to practice acting. No part of the movie made me empathize with the characters or their situations. It felt awkward and forced. And there wasn't any humor. I wouldn't watch this again.

Tanner Buchanan was great the leading lady definitely not. It was VERY hard to see the lack of chemistry and quite frankly, the lack of acting skills from the leading actress. The little sister had more raw acting skills and emotion than the lead actress. Myra Molloy was another gem of an actress, but sadly wasn't given more screen time.The story definitely had potential, but it was hard to watch the leading actress flounder through scenes with no emotion. Very green, lacks acting skills and direction. Then the male antagonist horrible from the costume to the line delivery ick. Shame because I've seen the actor's work and he is definitely talented. The characters weren't developed enough, but given it's target audience is that of teens it sufficed.I absolutely had a soft spot for the original so I had high expectations for this one. The highlight was Rachel Cook, Matthew Lillard and The Cranberries remix.Complete waste of time and disappointing movie.

Like most teenage chick flicks it predictably had a predictable story line. The only difference here was the lack decent actors! Tanner was the best of a bad bunch but he didn't have much to bounce off. Don't waste your time with this one!

I'll admit that I didn't care much about the original and I watched the remake just because it was a rainy day outside and I wanted something light. I gave it a six because in the end the goal of making me feelgood was acomplished, but I had no expectations.It's not exactly a copy and paste of the first one, the acting is okay, and the best character was the grandmother, she had two lines, one relating to Tom Sellek and the other a joke that was nonsensical but gave me a chuckle.Mathethew Lillard was severely underused.

I feel bad for tanner because he deserved better co-actors. The movie didn't make much sense but mainly the lead role should have been given to a REAL actress. There was ZERO connection between the lead roles in the movie which was disappointing. Would not recommend.

reviews.review_title: Tik Tokers need to stay on Tik Tok.
reviews.content: I understand that Tik Tok is a popular app, but why on earth are they being put into the music industry and now the acting industry? The main character girl can't act to save her life. But I guess her friend Kourtney Kardashian pulled some strings and bought her the role. The movie is incredibly predictable and extremely boring. I'd rather be stuck in a room watching all 3 movies of The Kissing Booth on repeat, than ever having to watch "He's All That" again. "She's all that" was such a good movie but this remake was atrocious.

reviews.review_title: So what, I kinda enjoyed it lol
reviews.content:
These reviews got so high standard for teen romance movie,
If it wasn't a remake, I think people won't be so harsh on it.Okay, the dance off part is really weird, and unnecessary.But I didn't know the main actress is a tiktoker until I read the reviews, which probably means her acting was just as bad as other Netflix original movies, not worse.I'd say it is not realistic because the losers back in my school time wouldn't have such a nice body like Tanner. But Tanner is so cute in this movie, so I enjoyed the movie. Some scenes are sweet.Isn't that what a romantic movie should make you feel???

The plot of the movie was ok, the characters were basic, the casting was ok, the filming locations were basic. I have to admit that my expectations for the movie were low. Eventually it was good. Also, in my opinion Addison's acting was good. I agree that sometimes it was cringy and predictable.
Pls take actors to make movies and not random so called social media fools. Bad storyline, bad direction and waste of time.Stay away from this boring movie.

reviews.review_title: Teenage drama, wannabe influencers, loads of cringe and product placements.
reviews.content: That sums it up pretty well, I believe.Poor acting, poor story. Literally nothing positive for me to say about this movie.

reviews.review_title: Take it for what it is
reviews.content: I've watched a lot of dumb movies. Ones with poor acting, zero plot, no chemistry amongst the actors etc. This movie had all of that and more. But I knew that going in. I didn't watch it for any of the above that was missing. I watched it for pure entertainment with low expectations. It succeeded. I don't think Addison was all that bad I'm her debut. The camera loves her. She just needs more opportunities on the big screen and not the small one.

reviews.review_title: The most honest review you will find
reviews.content: If you are looking for a good movie to sit back relax and have a good watch you are looking in the wrong place. The acting was generaly mediocre including the fact that Addison is oubviously not ment for the job she had been given. Now they were trying to give a cringy look and feel to the movie to make us remember how highschool felt but unfortunately it was horrible acting. Some scenes were better but the standard is very low to begin with. For people who are mad, they forgot that its a movie full of influencers and tiktokers so what fo you expect. Still better than the final Game of Thrones season lol. This movie cannot be given a 10 unless you have no ears, eyes, or common sense.

I honestly came into this thinking I'd write a long review of how unbearable it was but I'm left speechless as to what I just watched. Granted, I didn't have high expectations going into it but I gave it the benefit of the doubt. The best part of the entire thing was the ending with Matthew Lillard and Rachel Leigh Cook when there was slight references to the superior and iconic original apart from the god awful remix of the song 'Kiss Me'. If anyone hasn't seen that one, I suggest watching it and blocking out any memory of this film ever existing. There are many things to note about this movie but to cut it short, it's another cringey tween Netflix movie. I wasn't planning on watching this film as I could tell from the trailer alone that it wasn't worth my time but I did just to make my review that much more honest and reliable. Overall, I preferred the original one and will not be watching this movie twice.
Stop making intellectually impaired people like Addison Rae famous.
I bought everything advertised in this film.I am now bankrupt and weigh another me.

Tanner Buchanan, Rachel Leigh Cook, and Matthew Lillard were the best parts of this movie. Tanner carried the movie, everything else was sub par. Note to Hollywood, TikTok star doesn't equal good female lead.

This was bad. "My mother died in a plane crash". Cameron rides in to prom on a horse and just prior you hear the horse whinny. The dance off. Cameron's friend looks like a middle-aged housewife. The premise of Padgett wanting to make a nobody a star....a little tired. We've seen it before, and the original was a whole lot better. Worst of the worst acting by Addison Rae. I guess she only takes names that are a disease (get it? Addison, Paget)?

The one and only good thing I can say about this film is, that I discovered Cobra Kai, the series via Tanner Buchanan. That's why I gave 3*** What a waste of talent in this film. The it girl was horrible. This attitude of self-criticism and than all is nice and clean. Don't waste your time watching this grab.

This is the worst movie I have ever watched in my life. Litteraly nothing was good, not the story, not the camera angles, and defenitely not the actors. I think the only good thing about this movie is that it sets example of how movie should NEVER look like :D.

Bland
Boring
Acting skills: Non-existent."That really breaks my heart..." Could have fooled me, the main character(the lady) has no acting skills whatsoever. The dialogue is awful and the entire movie is just a huge cringe-fest.

It wasn't as good as the original but I found Addison Rae strangely likeable. I wish they had given a little more depth to the characters. Does the "mean girl" really have to so extreme? In the original, you still kind of liked Paul Walker's character but yet didn't want him to win. This "mean girl" is irredeemable. And the jerk ex-boyfriend was so bad that it is virtually impossible to believe Addison Rae's character actually liked him let alone dated him. Again, in the original, you didn't like Taylor but could actually still believe he dated her. But despite the flaws, it was a cute movie that was worth watching. Once. It's definitely not a rewatchable like the original.
An absolute joke! Can't believe they released this for the world to see.Such a shame Rachael Leigh Cook & Matthew Lillard agreed to be in this garbage.

The first movie was not great but it was a good one time watch. This was just like a a wrapper from Burger King!The only part that made any sense was the use of modern technology compared to the older one. Robbie just stick to to playing the broodie bad guy in Cobra Kai!Even Miguel would have brought more heart to the movie!

GO WATCH NEVER HAVE I EVER! That's how a real show is done. Genius writing, hilarious & not cheesy!!This show was gag worthy and I'm normally easy to please. I was compelled to write a review- what was Netflix thinking? Bring back ATypical & Sabrina. Terrible show. Should be on the Disney channel.

While this isn't the best movie on Netflix, these reviews look more like serious Addison Rae haters who you'd find in TikTok comments than reviewing a movie.He's All That carries the same story as She's All That (1999) but modernized. The truth is, it didn't have great source material. The original was....not a good movie to begin with. It's a tired storyline which we've seen in different forms from Cinderella to DUFF, ect.Sure, the product placements and celebrity camos are annoying, but that's not what makes this movie mediocre. Still, all these one star reviews are just a bunch of people who want to hate on a TikTok star.Is Addison going to win an Oscar for this? No. Absolutely not. But this is a rom-com, a cheesy, over the top, rom-com.It's a fun watch after a long day, nothing too serious, and has some light-hearted laughs. People are wayyy too hard on TikTokers than they need to be.

reviews.review_title: As classic as The Godfather, Schindler's List, and Shawshank Redemption combined.
reviews.content: Tik Tok is my future, and Tik Tok is your future! Best acting and original script. Your friends from the group home and small yellow bus will love this movie.
I love the original, as I was in my teens. This one's cute and light. Tanner Buchanan was pretty good.

I didn't expect a cult hit nor did I expect the acting to be good. I went in with super low expectations. But there were elements that did highlight the importance of looking deeper under the surface and learning what's really important and who true friends are...plus I remember smiling a lot at the sweet ending. Yeah sure, there's lots and lots of cringey stuff, but there was some good stuff mixed in there too. Cameron and his sister were the best parts. Not that bad.

reviews.review_title: Do not press play. Do not dare.
reviews.content:
I need to find a way to express how bad this movie was. It's 2am and Carmen from 12am should be ashamed of herself that she took the decision to watch this misery. 🙈😭
They call it a remake of an all time oldish rom-com "She's all that" and that makes me want to laugh and cry at the same time. - I want to craugh!Do.not.watch. Do not dare press play. Go and count some stones outside, it's a better way to spend your time.

Seriously! This is why you just have to watch things for yourself! I almost didn't because of the 4.4 rating! But I already know people can be ridiculous! It's not even remotely as bad as people are saying!! People are just mean.. it was a cute movie, not great.. but not bad at all! I actually really enjoyed it!

This film seems so fake, I mean so fake that for once I can even believe in conspiracy theories but not that this is a film and these actors aren't acting. Literally, the girl in the end was giving his brother an emotional speech but it seemed like she's gonna laugh in the end and say PRANK!!!

The acting was terrible. I honestly don't understand the point of this movie. I really feel like i wasted time i will never get back watching this. The cast was very random and honestly the movie is random as well. There was no need to make a second movie. Honestly instead of filming this netflix could be filming other things. Please don't waste your time watching this.

reviews.review_title: Not a 10 but better than the reviews!!
reviews.content: Ok I rated this higher because this does not deserve all the 1 star reviews its getting. Its not amazing by any means but still as good if not better than the original. I don't know if people are going in with to high of expectations or were just looking to hate it. Hey.

Bad Acting, awful chemistry between the cast, rushed plot, pick any flaw, this movie has it, the only part of this movie that I liked was the ending because it was finally over and I could actually watch something worth my time.This movie is so bad that it is genuinely not even worth pirating, just stay as far away from it as you can possibly can, you will thank me.
It could have been a lot better with stronger actors.It was just a nice watch. A kind of movie you keep on the background.The original is hard to top it.

This movie is so bad! No good acting whatsoever, not even from Addison! Why did they make this?! She´s all that did not need a remake, especially one that literally has some of the worst acting I have ever seen! Stay away from this one and do not watch it, it will make you cringe really bad.
It's slightly cringe and extremely predictable but honestly the worst part is the never ending ans excessive product placements in nearly every scene. Is this the future of teen movies? Scary.

reviews.review_title: This movie is worse than covid 19
reviews.content: I would rather be in one more lockdown than give this movie more than 1 star. Worst thing i've watched in past 10 years. Don't waste your time. And this Addison person is more fake than Trump's wig. Why would anyone stream this. Netflix, you are becoming a trash platform.

reviews.review_title: I loved it! The kids were adorable and Lillard was icing on the cake
reviews.content: Ok, so I'm old and sure it wasn't amazing but I was entertained. The leads are adorable and the girl and guy who played the jerks I couldn't stand so it worked. Seeing the great Mathew Lillard for sure made it worth watching, especially when he danced! Yup, us old folks kinda rock!

Look, this is never going to win an Oscar or an Emmy or anything else but if you want a fun movie that the whole family could watch then this is it. Some throw back to She's All That and if you liked that, you will be entertained.Don't listen to people that have nothing better to do than purge their bad days on the review board.

reviews.review_title: That Is A Lot Of Hate!
reviews.content: So much hate out there for a pretty great movie that is really sad! Was this movie worthy of any awards? Possibly not! But it sure as hell was not worth a 5 or below! The two leads had great chemistry and now a days with movies and Covid it is like actors are afraid to get close to one another, with good reason! You do not find that here. It was like they were unafraid to feel how they really felt.I will say this, I hate the Kardashians and when I saw Kim I rolled my eyes but in this movie she was exactly who I expected her to be so it all worked out. I miss these kind of feel good movies. This would be more for teenagers then grown adults so that is why so much hate. This is a clue, if you read the story of the movie and it ain't you cup of tea, then MOVE ON! For me it was like mean girls, she's all that and a few other high school drama movies all in one.The leads were beautiful to watch the whole time and the drama kept me in my seat. Never a dull moment, and could they dance! I would not say this was a rom-com it was more like a rom-dram! Lol And for me I loved it. Imagine that, an adult enjoyed this movie. Some ppl have placed the bar way to high now a days when it comes to movies!

If this is how some view the world, I can see why everyone in Cali does drugs. Every single person in this movie is vain, boring, and materialistic. This is clearly what Hollywood believes appeals to Gen Z, but it has backfired. The fact that they made a play on the classic "She's All That" is a complete mockery.
I like the classic one but Addison's acting here is not bad at all. The movie was average, the first part was dead but then goes interesting till the last part . A typical teenage movie i guess.

I think some people take things too seriously sometimes. Yes it's cheesy but it's just a bit of fun. I watched the original when it first came out and I still enjoyed this one. Tanner does a great job as always.
Just nope out of this one. Only good scene is Matthew Lilliard dancing att the end and you can probably find that on yt.

reviews.review_title: So bad! Like if Biden did a press conference and suddenly sharted and said I poo pooo doo doo bad.
reviews.content: So bad literally ruined my favorite movie. Hollywood has gone so down hill. Everything... nepotism and influencers now a days and the ironic thing is the movies bomb and they try to buy awards but we all know these movies still suck. So contrived. Not one ounce of human emotion. All it is is me me me. Tanner should fire his agents. He had a promising career but this movie has set him back. Stop hiring influencers!!! They aren't talented. We want to be moved because the real world is annoying and stressful and painful enough as it is. So stop insulting our intelligence.

reviews.review_title: Can a film be bad in all fields?
reviews.content: Cringe. So many cliches about gen Z. Not original story, bad acting. Can it be worst? Maybe, but it is still bad.

When I first heard that Addison Rae and Kourtney Kardashian were in this movie I knew it was going to be awful. The original is truly remarkable and this did not even scratch the surface of being remotely watchable. I've never been so uninterested in a movie in my entire life....come on Netflix you can do better than this. Let's get off the TikTok bandwagon and start making good movies again. That is all. Goodnight.

reviews.review_title: Not great but a bit twee
reviews.content: Was this good? No but was it the worst thing I have ever seen? Not by a long shot (people giving these low reviews have obviously never seen Lifetime movies or low budget horror films-now THOSE are truly bad) it was more that it was disappointing. They had a chance with this one but they botched it.I think it's safe to say that this is a product of the generation coming up now and the times. People don't have attention spans anymore due to social media. It's all been boiled down to seconds long clips and emojis. I haven't been able to find a truly decent movie in awhile now because audiences only seem to want to watch Marvel movies. If someone takes a risk and makes an intelligent movie - it doesn't do well because people can't get into anything unless it's non-stop in your face action. As a result we have one dumbed down movie after another and people wonder why. That is why this film didn't surprise me. I knew it wasn't gonna be great and I knew it'd be dumbed down because an Instagram star is the lead. Although honestly I didn't think AR did that bad of a job. She's not Kate Winslet but this wasn't what they were looking for.I'm usually a very harsh critic but as far as teen movies go you could do a lot worse. If you are comparing it to She's All That well then yes this is terrible. That's a classic and frankly you can't have lightening in a bottle a second time. There's only one Freddie Prinze Jr.I didn't think this was that bad. The lead guy and the lesbian Asian friend were standouts to me. Rachel Leigh Cook is usually great but she wasn't given much to work with and so she was basically phoning it in. Matthew Lillard was in this for a cup of coffee and he has gotten old which threw me for a loop. Also the thing that made me roll my eyes is - the lead is NEVER shown working out. He doesn't play sports nor do they show any weights in his house and yet...when the obligatory makeover scene happens he takes off his shirt and he's movie star ripped! I'm not talking a little bit of definition...I'm talking he looks like he did a 10 month strict regimen of eating and working out like it's his job ripped and that's just soooo unrealistic. My son worked out and followed a strict eating regimen from the time he was 15 until now (he's 24)...I'm talking working out EVERY DAY on a specialized program with NO steroids and he doesn't even have a stomach like that kid. You only get that way from working out all day and only eating chicken and fish every couple of hours. It's a full-time job. It's ridiculous when they show stuff like that like "He's just a normal HS kid and just naturally built like that." So unrealistic.This was very cutesy and generic and cliche which is what I had a problem with. Also I thought we were moving away from all white movies but nope here it is 2021 and we are still putting out movies with all the leads being white. They had different races represented but they were only tertiary characters. I thought the industry was trying to do better with that but you'd never know it by this film.I swear if aliens came down and watched these teen films they would think all the high schools on earth are the same but honestly where does this kind of H. S. exist? Yes kids are cruel and bullies etc...but the way things are portrayed in movies you'd think things were like this everywhere and really it's just not that way.This movie is a representation of everything that is wrong with the world. Our society has turned into something that quite frankly can't sustain itself for very long. We are churning out a bunch of mindless individuals who don't know what it means to make a commitment to anything (quit at the slightest bit of pushback), care about holding down a job, learning proper grammar or holding up anything more than good looks or likes on social media as the measure of success. Many people today are shallow, uncaring and unfeeling and that will come back to bite us at some point. Watching this just made me frustrated more than anything.If you want to watch a good movie go back and watch She's All That.

reviews.review_title: Not all that but not THAT bad
reviews.content: It's watchable and not bad, and that is coming from someone who grew up watching She's all that on a weekly basis. They have obviously tried to bring it into the 21st century and I think they concentrate too much on the whole influencer thing when they could have done so much more with it, but the end still made me smile. Great acting from the male lead too.

Cutesy take on the late 90's hit She's All That. It was... meh. Cute at times but not laugh out loud funny. The performances of the two leads was fine, but I wasn't feeling huge chemistry. I think a lot of this came down to the script and directing, which were okay but not awesome. Some good messages for young people about being yourself and the fakeness of social media.
Worst can't describe how bad and cringe this movie is so im not gonna bother other than saying it's the worst movie i've ever seen - by far!

reviews.review_title: Worth watching just for the hot guy
reviews.content: It is such a commercial movie, made to appeal average teenagers and review an old idea. They couldnt even bring themselves to hire an actual ugly guy to be transformed into the hottie two shoes, who would ve expected that an already cute dude can be groomed and put into a costume and will look hot? What a surprise. Also why tf is long hair considered bad on guys in these movies??
The acting was just plain bad. The story was god awful and i was very dissapointed.

reviews.review_title: Cheesey but the original wasn't any better
reviews.content: This movie is everything everyone is saying it is: cheesy, bad acting, poor plot, and lacking in comedy. I will say that Addison was surprisingly the strongest actor. The little girl from "The Game Plan" and the boy from "Girl Meets World" we're wonderful child actors but they looked like amateurs in this movie. I didn't like the original and this one was not any better, or worse.

Everything from the angles, transitions and let's not talk about the acting, it was horrendous. Not even worth your time.Why not get some proper actors who go through school acting, bunch of tiktok "stars" just won't cut it.

reviews.review_title: it's worth it but nothing more !
reviews.content: Honestly I liked the film I first watched it for adison rea but it is really good afterwards it is true that there is not a lot of suspense and that it is a bland and basic romantic film but that worth it.

The acting is so horrible like oh my gosh. I tried to give the movie a chance cause I loved the first one but this one does the OG no justice. How is it possible to get a cast full of people with zero talent or acting skills? DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

reviews.review_title: WORST FILM I HAVE EVER SEEN
reviews.content: Why did they have to do this?? Who asked for this film? The acting is just terrible, horrendous. And all the characters are plain and boring too, with the most cliché scenes. Absolutely hated it.

I do not even know where to begin. It had none of the charm of the original. It felt like an over the top parody of what teenagers are today. I know the original used the stereotypes, but this just cranked it to 11 and left reality. This deserves the razzie for 2021. I doubt anyone can out do this dumpster fire. I feel bad for the She's all that actors that got roped into this. Hope the pay day was worth it..

reviews.review_title: Better than I expected!! & I love Rom Coms
reviews.content: I honestly wasn't expecting perfection, but from the trailer clips I had hoped of it being a good movie. Addison definitely killed it and with more experience she'll definitely, progressively will get better.All the cast was definitely muah! I loved it!! There could of been a couple of things that could of been done better but under the circumstances our world is enduring, it was very good. Not a waste of time for me!Disclaimer: I am not the NUMBER 1 fan of Addison's but I follow her and she deserves the credit she needs!

Worst movie i have ever seen in my life. It's so bad that it's actually kinda funny. The acting was horrendous, the script seems like it was written by a third grader, and the cinematography was as bad as a drunk college student recording a snapchat story at coachella. If i could i would give this even less than a 0, hell even negative numbers are too high. In conclusion protect your eyes and your ears. DO. NOT. WATCH.

This movie has obvious similarities to the original 'She's All That' but unless you were born in the early 2000s, you will be very disappointed with this movie.This movie was created for the younger generations and those who are obsessed with TikTok/YouTube.They don't make movie like they used to anymore , sadly.

reviews.review_title: Shallow concept that misses the point

Then all they did was reveal that Laney had huge boobs in the first film and Cameron had a six pack in this one and the other lead characters started drooling over them. It's pointless. What's the moral? "If you're hot, go ahead and show it and you'll find love. But if you're not, you're just out of luck"? I'd expect something that shallow from a movie starring a YouTuber - a format that worships shallowness - but there's no excuse for the original film. THE PITT NEWS
"He's All That" Review: Addison Rae should stick to dancing, not actingNetflix's new rom-com "He's All That" is the gender-bent remake of the classic 1999 hit "She's All That," starring TikTok influencer Addison Rae.Katy Perry karaoke pool parties and "Drop it like F. Scott" Great Gatsby birthdays are just the start of the over-the-top elements incorporated in Netflix's new original movie, "He's All That.""He's All That" is the gender-bent remake of the classic 1999 hit "She's All That," and just another example of a cliché teenage rom-com revival that didn't need to be made in the first place.The story follows Padgett Sawyer (Addison Rae), a social media influencer from California, on a mission to regain her followers and sponsorship money after an embarrassing video goes viral of her walking in on her cheating boyfriend. She makes a bet that she can win back her reputation by building a new prom king "it" boy, in loner Cameron Kweller (Tanner Buchanan).Essentially, the plot follows the same basic story line of every coming-of-age movie - a popular conceited high school student resolves a problem by giving a makeover to an outcast and uses them for their own personal gain.The two leads fall in love, bonding over the loss of Cameron's mother and his love for photography. Once again, we have another teen movie involving a tragic backstory death of a parent. To no one's surprise they fall in love, but their bliss is derailed when Cameron finds out about the bet. They fight and then inevitably make up once Padgett apologizes with a long speech about her insecurities.The only true difference in this film compared to other rom-coms is that instead of using real actors, TikTok star Addison Rae plays the protagonist. Her performance should be off the charts considering she basically plays her real-life self, however, that isn't the case. In truth, by casting Rae, Netflix has made it clear that anyone with money can be on TV and has taken roles from countless talented actors.Tanner Buchanan's performance is better in his role as the mysterious loner transformed by Rae into a gorgeous pretty boy. However, the "makeover" really only consisted of a haircut, which in my opinion didn't need changing in the first place.The magical makeover is a far too common trope for movies and TV shows. While it may be entertaining to watch the characters get spruced up, it reinforces the idea that acceptance from others solely comes from looks.In other un-shocking news, "He's All That" incorporates way too many current references, with conversation overloaded with talk of social media followers, duck faces, livestreaming and internet memes. This obliterates the element of a timeless movie feel and can only be enjoyable to a 14-year-old Gen-Zer.This movie chooses to promote spoiled teenage rich kids who live in fancy mansions and wear expensive and frankly unattractive clothing. Even the food consumed is extravagant, from red cherry pop rock mocktails to almond flour croquembouches.On a more positive note, besides Rae, the acting isn't terrible. There are actually a few stars that make an appearance and a few newcomers who had a solid performance. Rachael Leigh Cook from the original film plays Padgett's mother. Matthew Lillard plays the school principal and, with his 10 minutes of screen time, has better acting skills than Rae during the entire movie.Of course, no Netflix film is complete without a guest appearance by a random unneeded celebrity. In this case, Kourtney Kardashian plays Rae's wealthy sponsor.There is also a pretty diverse soundtrack with the songs "For A Minute" by WizTheMC and "Kiss Me" by Sixpence None the Richer. This song parallels the original "She's All That," as it was used in both ending scenes.I was excited to see some former Disney actress familiar faces, such as Madison Pettis from "The Game Plan" and "Cory In The House" and Peyton Meyer from "Girl Meets World".My expectations for "He's All That" were extremely low, and they weren't exceeded. I did, however, find myself laughing out loud at some cringey scenes and enjoyed a few heartfelt moments from the side characters.Hiring Rae inevitably forces viewers to focus solely on her indecent acting, and turns the movie into a joke. The only thing worse than unprofessional acting is an unnecessary and random dance off - even if Rae and Pettis' dance off was pretty solid choreography wise.If you're looking for a movie to watch, I would recommend this film but for all the wrong reasons. The plot is more comical than the actual jokes. Instead of being let down by another failed movie remake, stick to watching the original "She's All That," and enjoy a '90s throwback filled with nostalgia.

He's All That (2021) is a gender-swapped remake of She's All That (1999) that follows social media influencer Padgett (Addison Rae) as she attempts to find her way back into the spotlight by making over the grunge outcast Cameron (Tanner Buchanan) after she is disgraced online during a fight with her cheating boyfriend (Peyton Meyer).I went into this with low expectations and somehow was still disappointed when I finished it. This film is awful in all aspects, from the casting to the plot, to the dialogue to the general characterisation. This is an hour and a half of second-hand cringe, and I question why people like Matthew Lillard and Rachael Leigh Cook wanted to be involved. That said, Matthew Lillard was the only redeeming part of this mess and he gave an excellent performance as expected.It is badly constructed with generally questionable shots and editing that is more reminiscent of a GCSE student film than it is a professional production company, and considering Netflix have put out some real winners prior to this, I am amazed that this went into post-production and no one said a thing about the quality of the work in front of them.As many reviewers have already pointed out, Addison Rae cannot act. She's a mediocre dancer and I'm sure that with her following on TikTok she must have some redeeming and entertaining qualities, but she is painful to watch and I do not understand the thought that went into casting her in a lead role beyond Netflix's desire to cash in on the currently popular clock app. None of the lead cast are particularly good, but she stands out among the worst.Overall a hot mess. 1/10.

reviews.review_title: I don't understand all the hate!
reviews.content: My real review number is probably a 6.5/10, but giving it a 10 to try to balance this out. I truly don't understand all the hate this movie is getting! It was a really cute Gen Z retelling of a classic movie! Of course it wasn't like She's All That, things change in 22 years believe it or not! There were awesome cameos (RLC and Matthew Lillard), cute homages to the original (the jerk best friend, the spunky little sister, the dance off, the "why do I know this song?", etc.), and typical Gen Z social media material.I really DO NOT understand why everyone is hating on this so bad. Addison Rae was endearing and adorable, Tanner Buchanan was an awesome lead, and all the rest of the characters were believable.In my opinion, if you're a true She's All That fan, you should appreciate this. Just remember it isn't FOR YOU, it's for the next generation. Why is everyone such haters?!

If we are to believe everyone in the generation portrayed in the film are as self obsessed as the characters, we may as well just give up, let off some nukes and let nature take over.The characters are all extremely shallow, even the James Franco lookalike character who plays the Laney Boggs equivalent "freak" is far more into himself than the original from the vastly superior 'She's the One'.It seems like nothing happens in this movie but trying to make sure they've ticked off some of the important moments from the origin film, but it's all window dressing around nothing of any substance.This isn't like Clueless or Mean Girls which are intelligent films masquerading as teen flicks, this is pure vapid emptiness trying to celebrate modern teens, but in the process showing how unoriginal, addicted to social media and slavishly consumerist they are.

With this, i'm not sure if it was because of the movie script or just the acting performances in general.Overall, I'm glad I watched "He's all That" to see what it was about, but I probably wouldn't watch again.Please thumbs up!

TLDR: The title of my review sums up the entire film in my opinion, it is lacklustre, predictable and all round rushed.I'd first like to discuss the camerawork in this film; its pretty trash for the first half. The first scene literally makes no sense regarding the camerawork, its shoddy with the common mistake of having the secondary camera take on the properties of the primary such as featuring the chat and reactions (this is while Addison is doing an live stream), however they do this fix this later in the film which it isn't that large of a point, they fix this by adding the chat and reactions to the sides of a wider display while having Addison film in vertical, which I feel is a far more realistic setup and an actual improvement. This film often feels like there were 2 directors or at times the director would just leave the set because the first half is far worse than the second. Another point on the camerawork for this film is that it is ameuter and frankly poor at times. While Addison and her mother are having breakfast the camera is shaking constantly the scene is unwatchable and I was thinking it was to reflect that Addison was in a rush or something but she clearly has rigid schedule and the only delay was having a chat with her mother. Another critique would be the fight scene; here the angles are terrible, but like below standard and I feel if they worked on the camera work for this scene it could've turned into a proper highlight of the film but it just ruined the scene for me.The Writing: honestly not bad, despite being a very predictable plot with some holes in the writing it actually presented a relatively premise in a moderately watchable style. I feel the writing and plot doesn't get as much credit as it deserves. From the second act where the bet is made that Addison would transform Tanner's character we know that as there relationship develops there would be eventual reveal that the only reason Addison is interested in him is because is a bet. However the unnecessary antagonizing of Alden's character is kind of out of left field so to speak. On one hand Alden is established to be sort of a veiled antagonist as her and Addison had been pitted against one another due to the bet and obviously the stakes were as high as 2 spoiled kids could place them. However the writers believed that adding another motive of just jealousy needed to be added and Alden just becomes a heinous and unwatchable character, shaming poverty and nurses which I felt was beyond uncalled for and unnecessary. The main antagonist for the first half was also pretty poorly written with a moderate critique on the immunity of an absurdly famous personality which brings me to a side point which is the unbelievability of this school; which is expanded on during the search for the bet person. There are too many bums and over successful people. The only middle ground characters are Tanner's sister and friend. There are literally no other characters who aren't either geniuses or internet-phenomenons or drug dealers. Also I simply cannot believe that these people are seniors like Jordan looks 25. Additionally they felt the need for Addison and Tanner's friends to get together, you know, just cause they're gay so they should be together, it was kinda unnecessary but I'd be lying if I didn't guess that the second it was revealed that both were gay. However that is about all the conflicts with the plot the rest follows a relatively steady if anything rushed pace as alot of these plots lead nowhere like they turn the whole Alden plotline into a joke that she wasn't even in the running for Prom Queen. While Jordan's popularity appears untouched even though that was supposed to be a massive plot point while also completely ignoring Tanner's popularity which turned into an absolutely ad hoc plot point of people filming his fight.Addison Rae: ruined this film, her acting is bland, unemotional and all round terrible. She acts as though it were a skit or joke; she looks as though she is rushing or barely knows her lines or had to have someone read her lines to her during shooting because her delivery is so off at some points. In other situations I simply don't like her delivery because the lines are cliche and cringe but that's just my reaction to it and shouldn't really be considered a review point. Addison shouldn't act anymore or if she did she really needs to learn how to act because I personally have never seen a worse display.Tanner Buchanan: loved him Cobra Kai, and kinda love him here, he was a serious redeemer of this film but there a lot of things that are simply not explained about his character, he has crazy abs just because, and he has serious fighting proficiency just because. Despite this his acting was fantastic and he really played the antisocial role well.Matthew Lillard. Another serious highlight of this film, his performance was masterful and a genuine redemption for the first half of the film.In conclusion, this film was meh, it tried too hard to be a tv show and not a film, it introduces unnecessary relationships and conflicts which just took and screen time and led to a 1hour 30 film feeling incredibly rushed with simply not enough focus on the main plot which was to make Tanner prom king; I guarantee that if you ask anyone what the bet was after watching this film they won't remember because the directors forgot. Nonetheless even though Addison is terrible, removing her from this film, its not bad. After it is a rom com, not much you can do with that.

I think the community can stop trolling now, the movie wasn't all bad. It was a fun take on a 20-year-old movie that I think was executed pretty well, being able to integrate things such as TikTok into it. I think where the movie went downhill was with the cringe and the acting, sometimes the acting was great and other times I wanted to rip my hair out. Other than that, pretty solid.

reviews.review_title: Exactly what one would expect for an updated remake of She's All That.
reviews.content: I do have some fond memories of She's All That, but I won't pretend like that film wasn't full of 90s cliches. Heck, it actually popularizes some of them. So, for a remake to be full of 2020 cliches, cheesy, and predictable wasn't exactly a big issue. The ''big difference'' is only a gender-swap between the leads. Now we have Padget (played by Tik-Toker Addison Rae), a popular girl who makes a bet that she could turn a nerdy guy Cameron (Tanner Buchanan) into a next prom king. If you've seen not only the original, but basically any rom-com in the last 30 years, you'll guess 85% of where this is going. Still, this sub-genre isn't exactly known for its creativity, no? It serves to shut your brain off for awhile and have fun. So, if you enjoy stuff like The Kissing Booth Trilogy, Tall Girl, or any of the Noah Centineo Netflix films, this will do. It's okay that it uses the social media concepts to update the plot, but it went too far in relying on it for my taste. The actors did fine for what they had to, and there is a nice moment or a funny joke now and then. It is still a predictable teen rom-com, so don't set your expectations too high, but it's not a godawful film either.

If anybody had high expectations for this let me start by saying that's probably the reason you've rated it so low.Considering this is supposed to be a comedy/romance for teens around the ages of 13-18 I don't think it's terrible.It's got some unrealistic scenarios that I don't think would ever occur but then again so does every single movie ever (arguably).And especially for young teenagers I think it's a great message
Padgett was lying about herself to her friends and to her fans and she gained popularity and money to support her mother and herself doing so, so even though the outcome of what she was doing wasn't harmful to anybody, it was harmful to her because she wasn't being herself.I do agree that the way this movie was filmed and edited is cringeworthy, and quite predictable but it's aimed at a younger audience, half of them only watching the movie because Addison Rae is in it.To conclude I don't think it's terrible but it could have been way better executed than what it is, but overall I personally enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: Three stars is really pushing it for me, which is saying something
reviews.content: I'm gonna be completely honest... if I could go back, yes I would watch it again. But only for like 3 or 4 of the actors.To start off, there was WAY too much music used for unnecessary reasons that I can't even begin to imagine why. Like it wasn't even good soundtrack music. If there was music playing in the background of a character doing something, such as a kiss, I would expect not "in your face" fast paced music. I would expect slower and I guess quieter paced music. Some made sense but others? Not really.Secondly, I'm a sucker for romcoms, right? The original was a romcom. This one? Not really. There was maybe one funny part about the whole movie. They tried but it was a valiant effort that just came short.Third, I'm so beyond disappointed in the casting. I was giving it the benefit of the doubt at first but I don't like the acting like at all. The only actors that I could really lose myself in were Tanner Buchanan, Madison Pettis, Isabelle Crovetti, and of course the original actors that were present. It was painfully obvious that Addison Rae was acting for one. There were others as well but as the main character, I expected more. I wanted to get lost in it but I just couldn't because you could tell it was scripted.As a remake? This movie was absolutely butchered. However, if you think about it as it's own movie and you go into it expecting a "Netflix cheesy movie with bad acting" you might get more what you're looking for. I was so beyond disappointed because the original is one of my favorite movies. I knew going into it that it wasn't going to be the original but I wanted to like it.I'm only leaving it as 3 stars because of the original stars and the fact that Tanner Buchanan really gave me the Laney vibe I wanted so desperately to see in his character. He really did an amazing job and bringing his character to life. I also really liked how Madison Pettis brought the Dean Sampson vibe back. I mean, she truly made me not like her character. Isabelle Crovetti also did a great job as being the little sister. And I truly wish I could've wanted to react the way she did at the end of the movie.

This movie was not needed. It was very painful to watch on top of that the product placement. It seemed as if this movie was more for product placement and to sell products. Addison Rae already does this in her daily life, didn't need to make it into a movie! Addison Rae, the acting skills are horrible. I'm not trying to be mean or rude but the only reason why she got a roll to begin with is because she's TikTok famous! It felt as if I was watching a 1 hour and 30 minute TikTok video! Not everyone that becomes famous due to social media should be a senior actor. It seems that everyone is transitioning into that, I believe everybody is good at some thing. But not everybody should go into things like that because it does not work out for them. Overall this movie was so bad and the fact that some actors from the original "She's All That" are in this reboot/remake but they had nothing to do with their roles from the original. I'm very happy that Freddie Prince Jr., Was not in this because that would be the biggest fail and disappointment in his acting career.

Why are the ratings so low for this? I'm giving it a ten under protest. I see and review a lot of movies, usually serious, and this is a basic teen-redeeming-character plot that totally works. Same writer as 1999's original "She's All That" and yeah I'm old because RLC plays the mom in this one! And nice seeing another original cast member Matt Lillard as the principal. Anyway- this should rate as a 6.0 or higher. Great cast- fresh pretty faces, well paced, and we see some of TB's Cobra Kai moves too! It's light and fun and worth a look. Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Take a look at the bigger picture...
reviews.content: So many people are missing the important messages of this movie. We have become so obsessed with social media and recording everything that we miss out on enjoying and living the best moments. Instead, we focus on documenting it and worry so much about what other people think.Please don't compare it to the original movie. They are apples and oranges. I think this movie was a breath of fresh air and is a great way to relate to the younger generations. It is 2021. There is TikTok, there is vlogging. That is life today and there's no reason that it can't be portrayed the way it is in this movie. People are rejecting it because it's different. Which is also what the movie is trying to say....it's ok to be different.Also, I thought the cast did a great job. There are many other movies or shows that have some corny scenes or lines. It makes it more fun. Have an open mind and stop hating on everything. I'd definitely recommend this movie to others and I would watch again a million times.

reviews.review_title: What happened to having real actors?
reviews.content: It's completely obvious the casting director chose Addison Rae as the main role because of her popularity/follower count. That really paid the price though, because this movie is terrible. It's so cringey you get second hand embarrassment just from watching it. At one point her arm was cut off because it blended in with the green screen? She was "passing out papers" in one scene and wasn't passing out anything in the next?? She should just stick to stealing dances from other creators on TikTok because acting is not her calling. What a waste of an execution. Some things don't have to be remade!!!

reviews.review_title: BETTER THAN THE KISSING BOOTH TRILOGY!!!
reviews.content: My first review vanished, so now I'm convinced there's a conspiracy aiding to this film's negative reviews.I'm in my 30s and will occasionally watch these types of films (teen chick flicks) when I don't want to give 100% of my attention to the television.But here's the thing - I didn't look away once!I actually found it entertaining.It seems all these negative reviews stem from the hatred people have with TikTok.How The Kissing Booth trilogy has better reviews is beyond me because those films are TERRIBLE!I'll admit some of the acting is pretty bad, mainly the antagonists, but Addison Rae makes a very likeable protagonist. And if you watch Cobra Kai, you'll probably be a fan of her male counterpart as well.Overall it was very easy to watch and not too cringe.The fact that this is my first review in my 10+ years of being an IMDB subscriber is a testament to how the film was more average than awful.Normally I'd rate it between a 5&6, but I'm giving it an 8 to boost the average.People love to hate.
There were some funny parts and I loved the brother and sister relationship. It's definitely a movie for a certain age range. I'm 29. It was cute. The dancing scene wasn't the best.

Even though it was woke, and predictable, I still had fun watching it. It's not meant to be a serious movie, isn't it.So lighten up all you critics.Tastes differ, and this was nice light entertainment. I usually cringe at too much woke, but it didn't bother me here, so that's already a plus.The characters were mostly human, and the bad guy just cracked me up!This is simply to outweigh the hate a bit...
And again I am glad to be beyond social media :-). Peace.
Along the same vein as She's All That... Thought it was cute, fun and worth a watch. Don't be cynical and pick it apart, or compare it; just enjoy it for what it is!

reviews.review_title: Why not just a sequel to "She's All That"?!?
reviews.content: Ok, so based on the reviews I have read on here. I am so glad I didn't see this film (the reviews pretty much summed it up for me). But, I was thinking why not just make a sequel with all the original actors from the original film (minus Paul Walker RIP). Like Laney (Rachael Leigh Cook) and Zack (Freddie Prinze Jr.) could still be together and maybe be married and have a couple of kids running around. Matthew Lillard could reprise his role as Brock Hudson and Jodi O'Keefe can reprise her role as Taylor. All the other actors could reprise their same roles!!!

I really never comment on these, but I couldn't believe all the negativity. Im a fan of the original, as its from my time, but I still thought this was cute! The acting may not be the best to some, but It is nice to see a movie flip from 90s keep its fun positive corny vibe. All the remakes or reboots have been too dark, depressing, and sexual. Why is everyone hating on Addison? She is so smiley and beautiful!

I'm honestly offended as a consumer that somebody made this film for us to watch. Absolutely zero effort was put in to coming up with a creative plot, all of the characters were unlikeable, it was completely unfunny, and the entire film gave me second hand embarrassment. It was actually uncomfortable to watch because I was so embarrassed for everyone involved with this project. Thoughts and prayers go out to everyone who is still recovering from watching this film. It's honestly mean for someone to write this movie, especially for a child/teenage audience. It was so inappropriate for no reason. My last brain cell died at the conclusion of this motion picture. Thank you for your time.

In the days where social media influencers control everything, Padgett Sawyer (Addison Rae) is at the top of the food chain. After an untimely live feed, Padgett's life starts to spiral out of control. To help get her back on top, she decides to turn the school's social outcast, Cameron Kweller (Tanner Buchanan), into prom king.Since this is a remake, the story isn't that original. The writing team did a good job of updating it and making it relevant for today's audience. The use of social media connects well with viewers. The sets throughout the film are what stand out the most in the production. The wardrobes, specifically for Buchanan, were another area of success for the film.The acting is bearable with some performances that stand above others. Buchanan and Rae have good chemistry throughout. Some bit parts worked well and moved the plot along as they were intended to. It was a nice touch to add Rachael Leigh Cook and Matthew Lillard to the cast, even though they did not reprise their roles for the original film. As Principal Bosch, Lillard stole the show.This film could have worked under a different name if some tweaks were made. Some marks were missed throughout and minor adjustments could have helped this film. Nothing production wise really stood out. Unfortunately, this film feels like everyone was running through the motions to complete a film with no originality to it. Doing the social media framing device was clever, but it has also become redundant in today's films.He's All That doesn't bring anything new to the table, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't watch it. There are well timed jokes, a sense of nostalgia, and some characters you can get behind. While it may not linger in your mind for days after viewing, you will have a good time watching it.

This follow up to "She's All That" is the perfect example of a movie that has mass appeal despite poor critic reviews. Some may call it bubblegum fair, campy, or derivative, but it avoids the insensitive pitfalls of its predecessor while elevating the story with better chemistry and a kinder spirit.Tanner Buchanan ("Cobra Kai"), and Addison Rae of Tik Tok fame have a great rapport. Madison Pettis plays well against type as the movie nemesis, and nostalgic appearances by "She's All That" alumni Rachel Leigh Cook and Matthew Lillard round out this great cast-oh and I haven't even mentioned Kourtney Kardashian!Too many people watch a movie as a critic, but going into it looking for a fun, light time-you won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Too much credit given to Addison
reviews.content: You propably clicked on this review expecting a bitter and harsh review (the six stars give it away never mind). Addison was definitely, not bad, but is that enough for such a high production movie? However I feel like even with a different actress, the movie would still be kinda the same.Really I haven't seen anyone say this but the actual problem is the writing. The characters have the emotional depth of a chicken nugget and they pretty much have zero development throughout the movie. It is reminiscent of the good ol' 2000s' but not in a good way.On another note, the soundtrack was good, Addison and Tanners' chemistry was great and some scenes were definitely funny.Lastly, I think many would enjoy this movie going into it just for their monthly cheesy and cringy shot of energy. If you're expecting anything more better skip this one.

reviews.review_title: Better than I expected- very sweet Remake!
reviews.content: It's probably more of a 7 or 8 out of 10 but I'm giving it a higher rating to balance out the unfair criticism this film is receiving. It's a teen romance so I wasn't expecting much but I actually enjoyed the performances and the story development. Even that random TickTock chick gave a pretty solid performance which I wasn't expecting. I don't like tiktok- I think it's pretty cringe but I have to be fair in saying her acting skills are fine. I'm not the most sentimental person but there were a few scenes that actually got me going "awww that's actually pretty sweet and heartwarming". And some of the jokes and lines delivered were pretty funny and clever. The script writer was the same writer for the original "she's all that" so at least there is some consistency in the quality of storytelling. It was also nice to see Rachel Leigh Cook and Matthew Williard again albeit in different roles. Matthew was pretty funny as always. And Tanner Buchanan gave an impressive performance. Id say the one scene I didn't like was the dance scene at the prom. Honestly, the dance scene from the original was much better. Overall, if you're in the mood for something light and fun and just want to watch a feel good flick this is a pretty solid choice.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as some of the reviews claims.
reviews.content: Let's start with the basics: The acting isn't perfect but it's not that bad, it's even great at times. I've seen a lot of hate towards Addison Rae and her performance but honestly she's doing a solid job through most of the movie, with some weaker moments but what did you expect. The production is smooth as in the story actually makes sense which in and of itself is more than could be said about some movies in this realm and the quality is better than I expected. The writing is solid and more importantly, the dialog actually feels natural for most of the movie. Which, again, is more than can be said about other similar movies.I never liked the original, always finding it too shallow and without any real depth. While this movie isn't the Mariana trench, it's at least a stream and not a puddle. The lead more so learns to embrace herself and falls in love with the guy for his personality and what he brings out in her rather than for the "makeovered" version she creates of him. (although, of course she finds the more put together, styled version more physically attractive, which isn't a weird thing. That's true for any and everyone. Humans prefer other humans who look put together, that's just how it is). Also, her qualms about her friends picking him for the bet isn't that he's ugly (as is supposed to be the case in the original) but rather because he is socially undesirable at school, constantly clashing with the popular kids, which will obviously get in the way of the popular vote for prom king.All in all, it's not an amazing movie but it managed to do what the original did not but movies like this should i.e. Make me feel good and as such it's a good update for the original. Now, the original has NOT aged well at all and this one maybe won't do any better in that department but then again it's solid enough now that I can't be mad at it.

I've seen tons of teen movies over the years, but this one is terrible. Addison is a terrible actress and worse as a dancer. I'm glad Rachel Leigh Cook got a paycheck after a while, but this movie is bad. The first one, She's All That, is corny but cute and funny, but this one, really bad. Maybe 12-yr olds would enjoy it. But, parents, beware: it will show young teens that it's ok to do drugs, drink, and have sex.

Don't know why there's so many haters. What exactly were they expecting? Same feel as the original with obvious updates. Fun inside jokes for fans of the original including scenes with Matthew Lillard and Rachel Leigh Cook.I love a good formulaic rom com and if you were expecting something different, that's on you.

Just no. I refuse to call this a movie. This is a long video sponsorship that is also an opportunity for adisson Rae to promote herself some more and boost her following. It's so sad because this movie is trending on Netflix. Just another way our society is rotting. Art is rotting. And you may ask why I saw this circus in the first place. I just wanted my time to pass and chose the first "light" movie I came across. I didn't expect this level of low though.No story here.No directing here.No acting here.The video of my fist grade school play is Oscar worthy compared to this.

Oh boy, there's a lot to unpack here. Let's lay our cards on the table, shall we? This movie was for me. I loved She's All That and know every line. We thought we were so cool and enlightened in our Williamson bubble of snappy and precocious teen dialogue. She's All That subverted expectations and convention with a no nonsense protagonist, sympathetic villains, a friggin awesome dance number, and our leading lady did NOT win the crown. Yes!I'm not saying the original is good, I'm just saying it's why I watched this movie, obviously. I put off watching this movie for a while. Look at the user reviews, the ratings, and the people involved, this was going to be a trainwreck, and to be fair, I'm not calling it a 'Little' trainwrech, but it did go off the rails a few times. I relented for a few reasons, morbid curiosity, nostalgia for RLC, and Lillard. I'm also a fan of Buchanan and his really good work in Cobra Kai, admittedly, that's his only work I'm familiar with. But that was it, otherwise, I only tuned in to validate my suspicions.This movie is bizarre, in the spirit of subverting expectations we went a little beyond gender swaps here in most places, in other places we stuck with it, we moved a couple of aspects around regarding the social economics structure, and have slightly fewer parents that exist in the teen comedy world. The bet is lame and doesn't pivot the action through the first plot point in an organic way, the antagonist is rotten and fails in comparison to an early career Paul friggin Walker!! (may he RIP). I'm sure most of the jarring oddities and forced dialogue was in context to my 1999 comparisons but I tried to watch this movie on it's face, which was just as hard even if it wasn't a a remake.Mark Waters directed this movie, he also directed Mean Girls...What?! How do you get so dispirit results from someone who obviously has an ear for the teenage voice, is this just about the script? The editing is all over the place and I felt like connecting story elements were deleted. Characters were in different places without transition or context and I was confused about the character's motivations a lot while watching this. We know the script is trash but that doesn't explain the direction, editing, production design, world-building, and continuity issues. At one point Buchanan busted out his greatest karate hits as well...for some reason. Why?! I make a mean banana bread but that doesn't mean it should be put into a scene, especially an important plot point scene that drives the homecoming king portion of the bet (that doesn't have nearly enough weight in this movie as it should BTW).But I laughed...I laughed at four places in this movie, I kept track. These were not internal chuckles or chortles as if to say, "huh, how amusing". I laughed out loud and couldn't help it. The jokes were all delivered by Buchanan. I know he is still relatively early in his career but I like him. I fear that he will fall into the same trap as Britt Robertson, falling for his own hype. He's not that good but he shines against his costars, which doesn't mean much with projects like this.This movie had all the same trappings as The Duff but not as good of a central underlying theme, which is inexcusable for an almost shot for shot remake. I found myself wanting to watch The Duff instead of this which is never good for the movie in question.If you watch this movie for Buchanan, I think he is doing just fine, if you're watching for an updated version of She's All That, just watch the original, even if you're not of that generation it will be what you're after if you're considering watching this trash. RLC's presence in He's All That is not worth it, Lillard cracks one funny joke, after that I felt like he had worn out his cameo welcome, the only constant underlying theme with respect to the entire cast of this movie...tragic.

This movie was not worth my time. The fact that I even gave it about thirty minutes is, at the least, insulting. I need to do something better with my life. I'm truly disappointed in myself. I need to- to read a book, self-reflect, touch grass... anything but punish myself with this unwatchable garbage.

So based on what I heard, I knew it had its complaints and was apparently a crappy movie. I decided tho to watch it as a joke to see what Addison's character was like, and see how I'd think of the movie like If i'd agree with others or not before getting more spoilers. So I watched it...Watched it and my main issue is that the characters really lacked emotion so it was hard for me to feel bad for the them and you can tell who they're trying to make their character come off as, felt a bit like watching a school play in the front of the class. Then many of the scenes looked like they got filmed in only 3 attempts and this movie didn't remind me of high school at all, the party and prom give off too much rich, famous, modern vibes plus many of the actors looked like they were over 25.I will give it that the movie is still watchable because the scenes do switch up quick enough. The characters at least do move around a lot instead of sitting in the same spot talking to each other back and forth for several minutes in a blank background (which botherd me in many movies/shows.) And the plot doesn't spread any bad messages that I know of.So overal not terrible like I thought but you definitely will see some things off with the characters and plot.

reviews.review_title: How Did This Crap Appear On the Same Streaming Service As "Ozark"?
reviews.content: Netflix, I don't understand how you can produce quality material, then allow this crap?!Tanner Buchanan is a good actor, he's very talented.
