People trying to be unattractive is standard fare in makeover movies; the true fun comes from watching opposites attract. But "He's All Thatcatfights, "'s confessions, and dance-offs lack the sting of genuine romantic strife, and there's no spark between Addison Rae and Buchanan. Rae struggles to modulate her camera-ready bubbliness in scenes requiring pathos, while Buchanan reluctantly plays the emo loner, switching too easily to handsome-loverboy mode. If they faithfully transmit the film's trite message "be yourself"

This looks like it was written and directed by a woke teen and is impossible to watch. The acting is absolutely terrible. Addison cannot act and neither can most of the cast. Seriously painful. The worst.

reviews.review_title: Nice remake on She's all that
reviews.content: Liked that it is a remake of the movie She's all that. A little cute note that the mother is the girl that got the makeover 22 years ago in the movie She's all that. It's just an easy movie to watch, for fun.

reviews.review_title: Watched for Addison Rae, was disappointed
reviews.content: I could tell from the trailer Addison's acting would not be good. Especially during the scene where she confronts her boyfriend, you can tell she's inexperienced and doesn't know how to act. I think she should've started out in a smaller role to begin her acting career. The storyline is what you would expect in a rom com, I think the acting suffered in this movie and I do like Addison but this was not it.
This movie is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Would not recomend to anyone to watch. Terrible casting choices.

If you watched the original 1999 film She's All That, then don't watch He's all that. Honestly don't waste your time. Bad acting except for the 2 original actors from She's all that, by the way that was the only reason I watched this movie. Addison Rae doesn't know how to act, honestly they could've hire a real actress. I strongly recommend the original 1999 film, trust me it won't disappoint, one of my favorite 90s films.

He's all that is a nice romantic/comedy movie. Is based on the move She is all that from 1999. A good idea from Netflix to take the old movie and change the roles. The movie try to pass the message that we cannot look and
judge a person only from apperence but mostly than how good character it has. I recommend to see the original movie too.

The story line was as expected, the movie was cute and fun. Directing and editing however lacked, on some of of the scenes. I can only assume this was processed thru covid. Otherthan that it was good.

Super super cringey & predictable but I still loved it! I'd probably give it a 7/10 but I don't think the movie deserves a 4.4/10 which is what it's at right now lol so that's why I rated it a 10! Worst part of the movie was the super cringey dancing. Also the part at the end with the horse was super ridiculous as well. All in all it was a very entertaining & easy to watch movie.Side note: The guy went from like a 2/10 to a 10/10 after his haircut! Worth the watch just for the hot guy!!
Most cringe thing I've ever watched. All need to take up different jobs think half the film made me sick or was so bad couldn't watch xxxxxxxx.

Yeh
I think this is not that bad.i think the horse is the best actor.
I didn't even want to finish it but I did and I was just as unsatisfied. Never again.. yeah some sweet moments and by some I mean like two moments.. the rest was so cringe. Nice try Netflix.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone is saying
reviews.content: She's All That was one of my favorites growing up so I was hesitant to even watch this. Honestly though it's a cute movie, I don't understand the hate that it's getting. No the acting isn't Oscar worthy, it is very much a Netflix movie but for what it is and how easy it is to watch it's a good movie.
It's really disappointing that i can't rate it lower than 1 star.
Totally Nailed it. A Wallflower would knows. Short and Sweet. Emotionally and Enthusiastically.

Already the 1999 original "she's all that" was considered a trash movie upon its release, but in what world and who had the idea to do a sequel but swap genders? Not only did they make her an influencer, BUT A TIKTOKER? This was addison rae's chance to show that she can't only dance but act, but she completely failed at it. I expected worse from her, but the teenage dream thing was just straight up cringe, like the whole movie.

reviews.review_title: You'll still get disappointed even if you expected low.
reviews.content: This has got to be the worst cliche movie I have ever watched. The emotion wasn't right, the script and the flow, but most importantly the camera angle. There was some scene that contains full body shot wherein the hands were moving but the body was stuck and there were a lot of awkward hand gestures. I was really disappointed because even though it was a cliche movie, I expected special about this. I was really bored and sleepy in the middle of the movie. Addison was smiling too much and it looks too much fake. It is really bad.

I actually thought this was very cute. I'm of the age when I would have been watching the original 20ish years ago and this has the same spirit. I thought Addison Rae was endearing --who knew?! What made me laugh was that apparently teenagers can't drink in movies anymore and they were having mocktails but swearing up and down. Times have changed, eh?

reviews.review_title: Not good, but still enjoyable enough
reviews.content: I went into this movie preparing to criticize all of it, and while I still did, it wasn't as painful to watch as I thought it was going to be before I started it. Don't get me wrong it's still a generic bad Netflix rom-com, but it did have it's moments (like basically everything Matthew Lillard's character did in the ending). Cam's character (played by Tanner Buchanan) was actually much better than I thought he'd be, he was surprisingly well written for a movie like this, and I actually related to him at times. Addison's character on the other hand was as generic as you could get in a movie like this, and even though you can tell she tried, she wasn't a very good actor at all, looking out of place in almost every scene she was in. I think one of the main problem of this movie is how cliche and predictable it is. I played a little game where I tried to guess what would happen next, and every single thing I guessed came true, the story is the exact same one we've seen in other Netflix teenage romance movies, and the "villian" is about as shallow as you can get. Overall it's a 6/10, and I'm only rating it positively because of a certain character or two that were great to watch.
I didn't find the movie actually that bad. It was a little cheesy amd the acting wasn't the best. I still got through the movie and managed to enjoy it just a little.

This movie is a commercial of almost 2 hours but it is an entertaining commercial the performances are so bad that some of them amuse me the script is simple and the plot twist is very predictable and all the situations and conflicts have already been seen before. I only recommend it if you have nothing to do and want to turn off your brain.
Loved the original and this isnt anywhere near as good but we watched it with our girls and it was a good, cheesy, light hearted, fun movie. Loved the karate scenes 🥋

reviews.review_title: How can a movie be this bad
reviews.content: Doesn't even seem like the director or writer even tried how can such low skilled people become director and writer gosh it's horrifying, acting was bad too but I will not blame much on actors because of what trash they had to work with as script.

It really wasn't that bad. I enjoyed it. It was like any other cheesy teen movie. Might not be for people who don't enjoy cliche movies. Overall, it's a fun and cute movie. Not as bad as everyone makes it out to be!

I feel weird writing the title of this review how I did considering I am 20 years old, but... wow, was this movie AWFUL. I gave this 2 stars simply for Rachel Cook and Matthew Lillard's appearance, which were both pretty minimal, but did make it somewhat easier to get through.This movie is 100% geared towards anyone 17 and under. Absolutely 150% NOTHING even close to the original, but are we really surprised? Lol. I tried going into this with high spirits considering She's All That is my mom's favorite movie, but sigh. Not worth wasting an hour and a half of your life. Go watch the original.

Petty teen one liners and a dance off at the prom?? They have a famouse singer that does music videos during school?? 😂 I'm not into the social media/ influencer scene but I'm sure all the teens and 20 somethings will like this movie because of it. Will never be the original. Oh and they used the original line of "being a fing bet and you can all go to hll" that lainey used 😒

I blame it all on the bad scriptwriting and poor casting. The leads are actually not the worst part considering the script they're given but some of the supporting are really bad like horrendous level of bad. The scriptwriting is a disaster, the "bet confession" scene, the ending scene with the HORSE and remixed version of "kiss me" omg I even need to skip those then because the cringe is SKY-HIGH. This remake makes the original seems like an oscar-worthy movie.

First of all,half of them have tiktoks and you all attack Addison. I actually liked her in the movie. For her first movie gig she was awesome and she needs to just practice more. She was actually more casual then Dixie in her series.It's a remake. It's for 21st - so TIKTOKS,INSTAS,LIVES - they are ALL now here and chill!Movie was good,chill - and literally enjoable.Addison you go girl. Tanner also and everyone.But I must ask:
Why did you make Rachel so slack? Like she is nurse and her daughter is paying her bills?Everyone in the movie were also great.

I was suprised at how much I enjoyed this movie, and I have already gone back to watch it again. I understand that people judge Addison for being a TikTok star turned actress, but I think she did a wonderful job for her first film. This movie also incorporated and stressed upon the negative impact of social media, including the fakeness and lies that can be presented to people so easily using those platforms. The male lead (Tanner Buchanan) and the female lead (Addison Rae) had wonderful chemistry together. This is definitely a movie I will watch many times!

This was the worst movie I have ever laid my eyes upon. From the horrendous product placement to the atrocious dance off to the terrible acting.... I do not even know where to start! We have a tiktok creator ACT??? Are you serious??? Maybe instead of getting someone who already has a following, why not give other individuals the opportunity to gain fame, ones that deserve it, ones who can ACTUALLY act. As far as products are concerned, I guess if you ever want a Core water, Dorito, Pizza Hut, Old Navy, Kardashian ad then this is the film to watch, but if you (like me) skip the ads on youtube videos then just go ahead and skip this disaster of a movie. I have never been so disappointed in a script writer and director. How can someone who wrote for Friends and One Tree Hill or direct Mean Girls and Freaky Friday create this atrocity. Do not waste your time, you will lose brain cells watching this.

reviews.review_title: Ok, shoot me but I really liked it.
reviews.content: I loved the original movie, I liked this update of it. The ONLY thing I would have liked more is if Padget's last name was Siler instead of Sawyer. Then Rachel Leigh Cook would have been basically reprising her role. I always want to know what happens after and this had great potential to do that but alas, ''twas not to be. But I am glad I watched it! It's a great way to relax tonight!

I actually liked this movie. I had to google who Addison Rae was a couple months ago...and I don't have tik tok...so I'm not predisposed to have any sort of feelings towards her...I feel like the movie was meant to be a funny/cringey high school movie. Some of these reviews you'd think people were expecting to give out Academy Awards for acting or story line or something. Unfortunately, I'm old enough that I can't relate to the high school kids any more. But the 'loser' guy was really cute. And I loved that Rachel Leigh Cook and Matthew Lillard were in it!

reviews.review_title: This movie was sponsored by... everyone.
reviews.content: The movie itself was not that great but my boyfriend and I got a huge kick out of seeing all the product placement. Labels were out and clearly visible. It kind of turned into a game trying to spot the next product. The movie itself was predictable and campy. What else can I say about a movie with a Kardashian in the cast? Although the movie seemed to be geared towards a younger audience, there is a brief conversation about sex and one of the characters drops the F bomb. It was a swing and a miss but I didn't really know how they were going to try to pull off the same premise in 2021 anyway. Watch if you're bored but don't expect an amazing experience.
I decided to dive into this no matter how cringe it would get and it wasn't so bad. I enjoyed how cartoony this movie is. Comedy has a nice timing in it.

I'm not really focusing on the fact that Addison was the main character but EVERYTHING ELSE. The script was so bad written, the plot was so predictable and the production was lacking through it all. It's obvious that no one took this movie seriously, it was only created for publicity and some fast views, otherwise they wouldn't have chosen Addison Rae, a girl that has never acted nor had any acting training to play the lead. It's very sad that Netflix is investing in this kinds of movies instead of real, authentic ones out there. I'm beyond disappointed. If I could give it 0/10 I would.
This is the guy who directed some really great classics movies like Mean Girls and Freaky Friday. This was a really bad movie. Just awful.

The "classic" She's All That takes me back to high school every time I watch it. It's nothing like a real high school experience but there was something special about the orginal. This remake lacks the heart of the original and the characters are extremely one dimensional. I appreciated the cameos but overall this was a not-so-surprising let down.

The ideas were there, but the execution was terrible. It has a modern feel to it, and there is one or two lines that did catch me by surprise with laughter... But what is with this need of making every modern teen Film with no time for the characters to actually build up a relation before they are BFFs? Give us longer scenes of build up! It's a shame the things that made the ending barable (like the dance scene) were only mentioned in passing through out the film. It could have done with more background on the dancing crew etc... I wouldn't watch it again.

Worth it just to watch him for a couple hours, the rest is pretty rough to watch. It has random dances that make no sense. Many cringe worthy moments. A modern must have same sex couple stuck in for good woke measure.

Addison Rae is talentless and doesn't deserve a movie. This is probably the worst film I've ever seen , the movie looks like it was made on Disney channel in 2007 . I'd give the rating a 0 if I could.💀

reviews.review_title: Maybe just keep scrolling on this one
reviews.content: I really was expecting more considering the writer for this movie is the exact same as the writer for the original. Unfortunately, since 1999, he has lost touch with the youth culture lol.It also had a few cute nods to the original, but still really not worth it. Wasn't even fun to watch in an ironic or entertainingly bad way. It was just bad.3 stars for Matthew Lillard being in it and being wonderful.
Honestly i really liked this film!!! A little cringey at times but Addison's acting was surprisingly good, deffo better than expected. Was funny and a good easy watch.

reviews.review_title: I'm worried that Gen Z will direct movies in the future.
reviews.content: Just imagine the pathetic quality of movies we are going to get.

I know alot of people have been saying negative reviews about her acting so I watched the movie and she isn't a professional actor give the girl a break for her first big role movie she did better then most.. from other 90 rom coms but the movie was a overall cheesy love story. She can move and she used her tick tock moves throughout the movie if she wants to be taken seriously, Hope she would drop the dance moves and focus on taking her acting to another level. I think with more practice she can be something great. Would like to see her out of her element and not happy go lucky influencer.. She's a beautiful girl and beauty can take you places in the big city! Hope the best for her next movie!

This movie so bad. The trailer literally spoiled the whole movie. I watched it because I wanted to see the hype but I felt that I wasted my time. The main love interest was already good looking. In today's society, we give chances to people who have no experience in acting, but there are people who are good at acting and don't get a chance because influencer are handed the job. Don't waste your time watching this film.

reviews.review_title: It's not a perfect movie but I enjoyed it
reviews.content: The haters are weird. Granted the first time I watched it I didn't super enjoy it but I did the second time. I can't expect it to be the same. It's not AS good as original even watching both with fresh eyes but it's enjoyable if you don't take it too seriously.Oh the main guy was hot even before the makeover? Welcome to every movie like this ever.I enjoyed the dancing and singing quite a bit and like the two main actors. Won't say any spoilers but loved the end credits scene. That's what it should be like for young people. Ahh.Enjoyed the cameos by the original She's All That actors but don't know why they weren't their original characters lol.

reviews.review_title: In my opinion, not too bad.
reviews.content: Out of all the reviews that are about 1 stars, I personally rate it 7 stars. Sure, some of the acting was questionable and seemed not the best. My favorite actress (I forgot her name) She had curly hair and portrayed her character very well, I even got annoyed by her! Haha. Some parts were cringe, but personally it was entertaining. I don't think it's the worst movie ever but I wish the acting was better. I actually enjoyed the movie, loved it!! But again, not the greatest acting from a critic point of view but it was entertaining to watch.

This movie was terrible. Cringe acting, weird tik tok dancing, predictable and the dialogue is so boring. It is an insult to the original she's all that movie. I mean it's not even comparable.Addison Rae is very beautiful but should jut stick to tik tok/youtube.

reviews.review_title: addison rae makes the movie tolerable END OF STORY
reviews.content: Addison rae shines in her debut but the damn film is so raunchy possibly so many sex jokes makes the orignal so much better the film would be much better with a pg rating it had so much potential.

reviews.review_title: Don't do it! I'm here to save you.
reviews.content: A great film to watch and roast with your friends cos there's plenty of material. Otherwise don't do it!Firstly, Tanner (playing the guy that's unpopular) is hot and his character was already cool. He and the actors from the original held up a sinking ship. The lead actress Addison Rae was terrible, so amateur and lacked chemistry. There were so many cringe worthy moments and awkward scenes. It was cheesy, cliche, lacked edge and character development. Ok idea, poor execution.

reviews.review_title: the kind of film you put on when you have rotten food to throw at the screen
reviews.content:
This was an experience
the acting 1/10
the product placement 90/10
the set design 2/10
the premise unoriginal/10
the script 3/10
the whole thing was a disaster from the weird tiktok based format to the clearly 25 year old ex boyfriend
in the year 2021 we're still making movies where someone isn't worthy until they are made "pretty" by the popular lead have we not passed this point.

reviews.review_title: Best part is the credits because it was OVER.
reviews.content: Cringe-A-palooza. Vapid cliche filled craptastic movie that never had a bright spot until the bloopers rolled at the end. Don't want your time. Watch She's All That again instead and NEVRRRR watch this garbage.

reviews.review_title: I cant believe how horrible this movie is.
reviews.content: I didn't have high expectations, but I mean this movie is just absolutely terrible. Nobody in our generation acts this way, non of this would ever happen in highschool. The product placement is through the roof which makes it hard to watch. Addison Rae is a god awful actress, it is so incredibly cringe. This movie actually pisses me off. I had to pause it and come back because I was filled with such rage that this movie was ever even created and added to Netflix.

This is possibly the worst movie I've seen in years..
The acting is horrible!!The original movie is still great with more realistic feel to it than this remake. This movie is in no way relatable.

There were parts of this film I enjoyed, but that didn't happen until halfway through the film. The start was very predictable and I almost turned it off. However there are some good bits, if you like the teen Rom-Com genre, give it a watch. If not skip it!

reviews.review_title: Not really sure what everyone was expecting.
reviews.content:
Did I go into this thinking it was going to be the best remake ever? Absolutely not. Just thought it might be something fun to have on in the background, and it was.Don't get me wrong, the movie did have some pretty
"But...why?" moments and some actors need a lot of work, but all-in-all I wasn't mad at it.Matthew Lillard will make it worth your while. You just have to make it to the end lol.

reviews.review_title: Don't expect this to be Oscar-worthy material
reviews.content: Quite enjoyed the movie. Most of the actors and actresses seem like amateurs instead of pro, but still, I didnt expect much so I wasn't disappointed. It's a good choice if you just want to pass some time watching something "light".Also, why does the popular guy look like a Neymar wannabe?! Lol.

The movie is very good. I like it! It's teenage movie and it has a good story. I can recommend to watch. My advice is to watch the whole movie because maybe in the beginning it's not good for some people but when the story actually starts, it's great. The movie is learning you to be yourself and to don't change because of the others.

I was SOOO excited to watch this newer version in comparison to the original.. and it was HORRIBLE. The acting, the production, the story line. All of it. So incredibly bummed. The ONLY good part.. was the last 5 mins.

I hated this freaking movie so bad like I would never watch some bad movie with addison rae again. The only good acting in this move is ... Also probably never wasting my time on a bad movie like this again.

reviews.review_title: I love trash movies but this was worst than that
reviews.content: Don't even waste your time. Just because someone is conventionally attractive and popular on tiktok does not mean they were born to be movie stars. Just like any other tiktok creator her acting skills are subpar and only ever used within a 15 second video.
I couldn't even go past the first 5 minutes. Worst movie ever. Don't waste your time watching it.

reviews.review_title: She needs to stop thinking she's talented
reviews.content: Dear god what a waste of time, I was already disappointed in netflix for renewing things we didn't want and leaving masterpieces like ~awae~, but this is beyond ridiculous, why from millions of talented actors who only need recognition to make it big in the filmography industry YOU PICKED A TIKTOK "STAR" ??! And especially a brat who thinks she's talented in everything when she ain't???? Poor guy had to force himself to have some nonexistant chemistry with her, and it's like she's reading directly from the script and for info THAT IS NOT ACTING , and don't let me begin on the weird camera angles and sponsorships and the nonsense that a Kardashian had to be in this, we don't want stupid gen Z cliches, we want a real movie with a consistent plot and characters with PERSONALITIES and actors that make us jump in the movie and feel like we're watching real people's lives. I also want to say that my review isn't based on my hate for Addison, and that some of the actors had talent but it wasn't enough to save the movie 😔

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I thought
reviews.content: I'm going to be honest, I strongly dislike Addison Rae and everything about her. However, the movie wasn't that bad.It's your normal cheesy cliche high school rom com. Very typical and if you don't like it, then obviously it's not the genre for you. It was nice to see the main girl character from the original. There were some funny moments and I loved the side WLW relationship.However, Addisons acting was mediocre at best. Was very stiff and when it wasn't stiff, it felt like a little bit too much, especially with the constant head nodding. The karaoke scene was somewhat nice, however the tiktok dancing completely ruined it and upped the cringe factor. As well as the dance off. It doesn't make sense to me how someone so against people (in this case; the main guy) would just automatically jump in the karaoke to help out someone, and would also allow her to just cut his hair. Wouldn't he have had his hair that long for a reason? It could just be me over thinking though.Overall, it has some good aspects and some bad aspects. Me, being someone who enjoys the cliche rom coms, liked it. But there were many things about it that I didn't like.
It's so cringe and confusing i'm sorry i don't get it.

reviews.review_title: Great if you're ready to laugh at the acting
reviews.content: Main character is not an actor, she's an instagram influencer just like her movie character. Props to picking a normal sized woman but every teen is again played by a 20-something year old whose makeup is done way too much. At least most of the other kids in this can act. Trying to make it more relevant with twitter, instagram, live stream just makes it more exhausting. Good if you're wanting to do something else and have this movie in the background. Also, why is Kourtney Kardashian in this..?

I watched for Tanner. But his part is only okay in this film. I won't blame him though, coz you'll know why if you watch it! With Tanner in the cast, I expected the final dance-off would include him, but no, and you'll know why if you watch it! And, the most basic thing that this kind of movie should have is the spark between the couple. There. Is. None. Man! Why did you agree to be in this project, Tanner?
It's a shame. The acting is horrible! Just like all the other reviews, it is indeed Cringe!
Never let tiktokers act ever again !This movie is so bad that i almost felt i need to vomit!!!!!This movie is a torture!!!!!
Nice and entertaining movie. Does hommage to the original. I would recommend.

Almost seems improvised and reaches new levels of awful. Very hollow storyline and actors that are easier to dislike than like. And if the band your in starts playing a different tune, I'll see you on the dark side of the moon.
Even though it's not that good but enjoyable, and for addison it's not bad for a first time.
This movie is so predictable right from the starting wasted an hour of my life watching this don't bother seen to many movies in the past that are exactly on the same lines as this give it a miss.
I HATE IT and it's so cringe AHhHHhHhHhHhH WHY Addison Rae AHhhHhhHH SOOOoOOoO BADD.

reviews.review_title: Tanner Buchanan is why I watched
reviews.content: Ok so I had really bad expectations (IMBD 4.4) already prior watching the film and i must say it still ended up pretty cringey... that said, I did find Tanner Buchanan's character convincing as this loner type of person and that kept me interested for the most part.My 3 stars go to Tanner, Rachael Leigh Cook (from the original She's all that) and Matthew Lillard.

I wanted to watch this movie with no prejudice, but damn what was this movie bad. The acting is garbage, the story is bad and the whole movie is very cringy. I wouldn't recommend anyone to watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: I personally liked, but if you love the original one, you might be disappointed
reviews.content: The majority of the reviews talk about the bad acting and some poor technical stuff. They are right, although I liked Addison performance considering it's her first major role. The little sister is a really good actress and Rachael is stunning as always.Now, about the storyline. People need to understand that 90's have passed. This movie wasn't made for those who liked the original one, but for teens who watch netflix. And, in this days, tiktok and other social medias are what they like, that's simple. I'm a nostalgic too - I watched She's All That because of this, not because it's a masterpiece - but I try to forget nostalgia when I'm watching a high school movie from 2021.I could give it a 7, even an 8, but what did they do with Kiss Me exceeded the limits of my goodwill. That was too much.In short, if you want a movie like the old ones, don't waste your time. But if you want a not-brillant heartwarming teen movie of modern times, just to turn off the brain and smile, He's All That is a good choice.

While watching it I was constantly asking myself wth am I doing? What is this?It was like torture."waste of time + waste of money"
?With all these 1s,how could it be a 4.4?srsly 4.4 is just TOO MUCH.

reviews.review_title: this movie should be called "Second hand embarrassment"
reviews.content: I know a lot of people were hating on it because of Addison but I really wanted to watch this movie and give it a chance. Oh boy was this movie funny. I'm giving this a 3/10 because how much the bad acting and bad filmography made me laugh. How'd they NOT get embarrassed while making this movie? And the dance scene?! What was that lol! If you currently feel like your worthless and want yourself to feel horrible then you should definitely watch this movie because this is pure torture.
Super cringe, terrible acting. I don't know what else to say...
It's weird how much I enjoyed that movie. The acting was actually Ayt and the story was like any other "chick flick" but who actually care enjoy it for what it is.

I honestly didn't expect it to be this good. Me and my sister loved it. Addison's acting is actually really good. Brin's emotions on the prom night was honestly the best. The story line is a little basic, but it's still good. The use of social media is a lot, but that is kinda the point. I recommend it. I kinda want a part two..

This 'movie' is a cringe-worthy mess of overused topics, terrible acting, poor characters, awful directing and just about any other possibly bad thing about a film. He's All That was clearly Addison Rae's attempt at trying to "extend herself" into film, which is such an overdone move that basically all popular 'internet personalities' attempt to do to extend their 5 minutes of fame. This movie was clearly targeted at pre-teens who would eat up any visual including their favourite 'internet personalities'. The other people involved in the movie were just as forgettable sadly and did not make up for the frustrating and cringe presence of Rae. Certainly not keen on this title and pretty upset if this is the way Netflix Originals are heading.

This movie is what it is..A remake of "She's All That" but gender swapped.I honestly love how the movie was able to pick on itself and the genre of 90's high school movies.. love seeing some of original cast.. my favorite parts were the PA guys comments and Matthew Lillard..Addison Rae's acting was very lackluster.. Most of the time she just looked bored..The writing was okay... not the worst, but definitely not great.I would have loved to have more of the Quinn and Nisha characters honestly.. and Cameron and his sister..
The acting was a little cringe but it was a good cheesy movie .I don't get why people are being so mean about Addison Rae being in it she did good for her first movie!!!

reviews.review_title: i paid nothing to see this and i want my money back
reviews.content: This 'movie' was so bad i haven't stopped cringing since i first watched it when it came out 2 months ago. I can't even put into words my passion of hatred for this mess of a production. The acting, the casting, the storyline, the script. EVERYTHING THEY POSSIBLY COULD HAVE DONE WRONG, THEY DID WRONG. reviews.review_title: A very looong commercial on Netflix
reviews.content: Let's play a drinking game - drink every time there's a product placement. Just kidding, you might need an ambulance halfway into the movie. This movie, if you can even call it that, was really just one really long ad for KFC, Pizza Hut, Huda Beauty, Core water, Bounty paper towels, etc. I felt like I was watching a cheaply made at-home video.That doesn't excuse the fact that the remake itself is a poor excuse for a movie, or course. You can't redo a classic. In fact, I would've given this one star, but I gave one extra star for Rachel Leigh Cook & one extra star for Matthew Lillard. Otherwise, the entire premise is a snooze fest - influencer gets snubbed by boyfriend & loses her sponsorship. And who hired the Kardashian for god's sake? She can't act to save her life, yet she gets multiple cameos. Did she sponsor the movie or something? Or did her mother sponsor it?Overall I give 1 star, but the fact that there are 2 original actors from the actual classic, I gave this abomination 2 additional stars. Stop trying to remake our youth & then proceeding to butcher it. It's pathetic.

I did cringe at the dance scenes and a moment at the end when Cameron comes riding up to the high school on a horse. At least they showed a truck and horse trailer in the background so it seemed more believable cheesey in that moment.I think the 1 star reviews are incredibly unfair and perhaps only so because of 'tiktok' hate. I'm in my 30's and looking at this objectively I would normally rate it a 6. Pleasing, cutesy, teen rom com. I would even watch it again. Rated a 10 to balance the absurd 1 star reviews.

To start, the original movie isn't written well either so of course this one isn't going to be amazing. The movie wasn't that bad but the large amount of promos/ads and cringey dancing is what made me hate this movie at times. Yes, Addison Rae isn't a good actress but some of these reviews have a huge negative bias towards her. I would pool this movie with ones like "The Kissing Booth" or "To All The Boys I loved Before". Definitely not a good movie, but it's entertaining and easy to watch. It definitely doesn't deserve all the hate that I'm seeing in the reviews.

Now, to start: I was never a big fan of "She's All That." It was a fine movie, but never one that I held in any particular reverence. This movie was pretty much what it claims to be, in all regards, and if you set your expectations properly before ever hitting play.Cons: Maybe there's no avoiding it, but influencer culture is so depressing, so I hated that aspect of the movie; I hate that aspect of modern society, too, so that was never going to be a win for me.Pros: Tanner Buchanan is really growing as an actor, and I hope that he continues getting roles, and catches the attention of casting directors outside of the scope of Netflix. I liked him in Cobra Kai, but thought his acting there was a little forced, and lacking; I was pleasantly surprised with his performance here! Seriously... a lot of growth, and I will be glad to see him continue to get roles.Also... the addition of Rachael Leigh Cook and Matthew Lillard, plus the Sixpence None the Richer song "Kiss Me," was a bit of fun for watchers of the original film. Found myself feeling more nostalgic than I expected, and that's from someone who, as I mentioned before, was not really a huge fan of "She's All That".This movie hits the marks/checks the boxes, if you're expecting a teen rom com, and not a Scorsese movie. If you're looking for a lot of depth or a challenging film, obviously look elsewhere. If you're looking for a formulaic movie that's the equivalent of junk food, this title is fun enough.

Since this is essentiallyObviously, this is gender switch on the 1999 film She’s All That. This time an Insta influencer (Addison Rae) takes on the project of turning one of her high school’s apparent losers (Tanner Buchanan) into a hottie. Since this is essentially based on Pygmalion, you know how it’ll go down, so the challenge is getting there. Rae seems slightly artificial (but that may be the character), but Buchanan makes a charming, sexy romantic interest. Actors in the original, Rachael Leigh Cook and Matthew Lillard make appearances (his turn is one of the comic highlights). Otherwise, there aren’t any especially kooky or fun supporting characters and nothing about it is anything but expected. An upbeat but very teen romance.

meta_summary: He's All That reimagines the original plot of the 1999 teen classic She’s All That. The contemporary story follows an influencer (Addison Rae) who accepts a challenge to turn the school’s biggest loser (Tanner Buchanan) into prom king.
